attributes.action: extend the provisions of the hunting ban by banning the wearing of formal hunting attire and making it illegal for more than two dogs to accompany horse riders
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Police are to stop monitoring hunts in a policy change that effectively marks the collapse of the hunting ban.

New guidance from the Association of Chief Police Officers says that forces have more pressing priorities than spending valuable time clamping down on hunts and suggests that monitoring should be cut down.

It brands the 2004 Hunting Act 'cumbersome' and 'unenforceable' because gathering evidence of illegal hunting has proven difficult.

In order to ensure that the rule of law is respected and the electorate's wishes respected, the hunting with dogs legislation needs to be re-written in favour of the law.

If horseriders are wearing formal hunting attire whilst on horseback or accompanied by more than two dogs then there is clearly the intention to engage in an activity with the potential to result in the death of a fox or other animal. If these activities are banned with the threat of a prison sentence then it will be easy to gather evidence and would act as a strong deterrent.
